newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stks close off on lack of foreign interest.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stks close off on lack of foreign interest.

text.p: Caracas stocks closed off in light trade for the second straight session due to lack of foreign bids, traders said.
"What's more I don't think we see any foreign funds returning to the bolsa over the short term," said Cavelba broker Harold Cuellar.

The market's leading 19-share index slipped 0.45 percent to end at 6,374.02 points as 17.3 million shares traded worth 2.6 billion bolivars ($5.5 million), according to preliminary figures from the exchange.
Volume was boosted by a cross-trade of one million Corimon B shares, which ended up 0.05 bolivars at 9.40.

Nearly one million shares in leading utility Electricidad de Caracas also cross-traded. The stock closed ahead a hair, rising 0.75 bolivars to finish at 465.75 bolivars. But that rise -- Electricidad is still the market bellwether -- was not enough to firm the rest of the market.
Among traded issues, 20 fell, 11 rose and 11 closed flat.
